meanings.definition: A disease caused by eating raw or undercooked meat infected with the larvae of a parasitic worm.
meanings.sent1: Trichinosis can result from consuming meat that is not properly cooked.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with trichinosis after they ate undercooked pork.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the only way to avoid trichinosis was to cook meat until it's as tough as shoe leather.
meanings.sent4: The spread of rumors in the small town was like trichinosis infecting every conversation.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of trichinosis made everyone at the table lose their appetite.
